Fix the following in the suite:

$ codespell redfish/task_service/test_tasks.robot
redfish/task_service/test_tasks.robot:294: completetion ==> completion


$ python3 -m rflint -rA robot_standards -R robot_custom_rules.py redfish/task_service/test_tasks.robot
+ redfish/task_service/test_tasks.robot
W: 164, 110: Line is too long (exceeds 110 characters) (LineTooLong)
E: 253, 0: No keyword documentation (RequireKeywordDocumentation)
Line no 21 -24 , Can you add this is json file and store in data directory.
Suggestion: Verify Redfish Task Service Attributes
Can you add . in end of documentation.
Can you merge the test case line no 78, 88,116, 132.
Suggestion: Test Validity Of Initiated Task Instance And Task State or Test Validity Of Generated Task Instance And Task State
redfish should be used as Redfish. Can make correction in other places.
Same as line no 30. Can you address this in all the places.

Suggestion: task_type  
Default value for task_type is dump.
when task_type parameter is dump then keyword initiate bmc user dump creation and returns task id.

Suggestion: Can you make this keyword more generic.
e.g. if user pass 0 - Get complete history of task instances
in case 1 - Get first instance of task instance and so on.
if user pass multiple instance like 1, 2 then return with list of task instance.
Kindly ignore the oversight. This keyword have not been used anywhere in test case. It was induced as a part of future enhancement. Since the keyword is not relevant right now, have removed the same.

I think we should give the json file name more appropriately

can we put this data in to https://github.ibm.com/openbmc/openbmc-test-automation/blob/master/data/task_state.json ??

Also add "comment" field
Have set the json file name as task_service_properties.json since it contains properties other than task state also

Verify if CompletedTaskOverWritePolicy is a valid value.

End with period for all the comments in the test script
instead of having no/yes .. can u prefer True/False

To be precise

Load Task State Properties Data

There is an existing file for task related data -->data/task_state.json.
Please check if these can be added to that file.

Pls add it to data/task_state.json and verify the entire dictionary data from there for Status

eg: Expected values to be put in json file

"Task_service_status":{"Health": "OK", "HealthRollup":.......}

While verifying:
&{expected_status}=  Evaluate
    ...  json.load(open('${code_base_dir_path}/data/task_state.json'))  modules=json
    Dictionaries Should Be Equal  ${expected_status}  ${resp["Status"]}

1.add one line of space
2.taskservice should be task service (change this in other places.)

1.add one line of space and value comparison start from line number 69 so can you place this comment just before line number 69
2. Same comment applicable to other places.

1.Can you change '&' to and
2.End the print message with '.'
3.Same comment applicable to other places.

Since the following validations are specifically for BMC dump, is there any significance for this separate keyword --> Generate Task Instance And Return Task Id?
If you want it to be general and work for other tasks too then that flexibility should be provided in validation too.. eg.@140 validation only works for bmc dump

Yes, the keyword has been named generically as "Generate Task Instance And Return Task Id" with the "task_type" being added as a parameter. So that any redfish action which generates task could be substituted in place. 
As suggested, have modified the validation check for target URI property so that any task type can be validated.

1.Can you change Diff. to difference
2.End the print message with '.'
bmc_dump just to be specific as there are other dumps too

Can we move this to lib/dump_utils.robot?

Create User Initiated BMC Dump And Return Task Id
Can we move this to lib/dump_utils.robot?
"Wait For Task Completion" Keyword is applicable for any task type. So have placed in the keyword section of task test script itself.
It is a generic keyword. Keeping it in the test suite restricts other modules from using it. Moving it to lib/dump_utils.robot will make it open for all.
Got it. Moved the keyword to lib/dump_utils.robot
Can you compare exact value in If condition e.g. Exit For Loop If 'True' == '${out}'

Suggestion:


${time_diff}=  Subtract Date From Date  ${cur_time}  ${bmc_time[0]}
...  date1_format=%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S  date2_format=%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S

# Compare system time and time displayed in task service URI.
${time_diff}=  Evaluate  ${time_diff} < 5

Should Be Equal  ${time_diff}  ${TRUE}
...  Time Difference between BMC time and time displayed in task URI is higher.


Same comment applicable to other places.

Suggestion:

I was rethinking on current test case name and came with optimize test case name. let me know your comments.
Test Generated Task Instance Validity And Task State

Suggestion:

1. Line number 127-134
# Verify task start time is within 10s of current time.
${resp}=  Redfish.Get Properties  /redfish/v1/TaskService/Tasks/${task_id}

${start_time}=  Get Regexp Matches  ${resp["StartTime"]}
...  (.+)[\\-|\\+]\\d\\d\\:\\d\\d  1

# Compare system time and time displayed in task service URI.
${time_diff}=  Subtract Date From Date  ${cur_time}  ${start_time[0]}
...  date1_format=%m/%d/%Y %H:%M:%S  date2_format=%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S

${time_diff}=  Evaluate  ${time_diff} < 10
Should Be Equal  ${time_diff}  ${TRUE}  Time difference greater than 10 seconds.

2. Can you address above comments in other places.

3. Can you add this regex "(.+)[\\-|\\+]\\d\\d\\:\\d\\d" I variable and add in robot variable section. then use the define variable in your code.

Suggestion:

I was rethinking on current test case name and came with optimize test case name. let me know your comments.	
Verify Task Persistency Post BMC Reboot

Suggestion:

Generate Task Instance And Wait For Completion

${initial_task_count}=  Redfish.Get Attribute  /redfish/v1/TaskService/Tasks
...  Members@odata.count

Redfish BMC Reset Operation  reset_type=ForceRestart

${current_task_count}=  Redfish.Get Attribute  /redfish/v1/TaskService/Tasks
...  Members@odata.count

Should Be Equal  ${initial_task_count}  ${current_task_count}

Generate Task Instance

can you mention about default value.

same comment applicable to other places.

Can you add a line by stating that default value for task_type is bmc_dump.
variable time_regexp_pattern should be in capitals letters.
can you compare the value with Integer or String based on the data types received.
can you change this expected_completion_state to expected_status and same need to describe in Description of argument(s).

Can you please add an ELSE condition to this to raise error. If a value other than bmc_dump is passed, it will error out in the next line. But the failure doesn't give ample information right away. So adding an ELSE condition will flag the right error.
no ewline at end of file.

#Resource            ../../lib/ipmi_client.robot
#Resource            ../../lib/rest_client.robot
#Resource            ../../lib/code_update_utils.robot
#Resource            ../../lib/common_utils.robot
#Resource            ../../lib/utils.robot


You wont need these , can u remove them ?
To be clear, this passing requires that the task take longer than the poll time of this get.

Where is the get that actually returns the completion of the post?  I see Wait For Task Completion is polling the task object, but where is the read of the Task Monitor that returns the actual completion?


As described in the Redfish school for tasks, the task monitor should return 202 while the task is progressing, then return the response as if the http operation was performed synchronously instead of deferred to a task.

Also, per dmtf 2066 8.3 status codes, the Location header should have a Location header with the URI of the task monitor (see table 14 in 2022.2).  The task representation in the task resource is MAY in table 14, but SHOULD in 12.2 asynchronous operations.  Also there is a Retry-After header in 12.2.

Also, in general, when not testing the implementation of the task service, it would be useful to have a test that checks the task monitor at the described interval, with some limits for total task execution time.
